fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the wolpertinger moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The wolpertinger doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The wolpertinger's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The wood golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Fey Touched
fields.desc: The woodwose has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the woodwose to sleep.

fields.name: Innate Spellcasting
fields.desc:
The woodwose's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). The woodwose can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: shillelagh
3/day: pass without trace
1/day: entangle

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The woodwose can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Brave
fields.desc: The wyvern knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

fields.name: Ring of Feather Falling
fields.desc: When the wyvern knight falls while wearing this ring, it descends 60 feet per round and takes no damage from falling.

fields.name: Disguise
fields.desc: The xenabsorber has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as the type of creature it is impersonating as long as it has at least 1 trait from that creature.

fields.name: Trait Mimicry
fields.desc: As a bonus action, a xenabsorber can take on 1 nonmagical physical trait, attack, or reaction of a beast or humanoid with a challenge rating equal to or less than its own that it has seen within the last week (see Trait Mimicry sidebar). It can have up to 5 such traits at a time, no more than two of which can be attacks. Each trait lasts until the xenabsorber replaces it with another trait as a bonus action. If the xenabsorber goes a week without exposure to a single beast or humanoid, it loses all of its traits and reverts back to its true, blue crystalline form.

fields.name: Evasion
fields.desc: If the xiphus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the xiphus instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

fields.name: Lightning Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the xiphus is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the lightning damage dealt.

fields.name: Siphon Time (Recharge 5-6)
fields.desc: As a bonus action, a xiphus chooses one creature it can see. The xiphus' clockwork heart vibrates rapidly, bending time to give the xiphus the upper hand against its chosen target. The xiphus chooses whether to have advantage on its attacks against that target or on saving throws against spells cast by the target until the start of the xiphus' next turn.

fields.name: Startling Speed
fields.desc: The movements of a xiphus are so swift that it is almost invisible when in motion. If the xiphus moves at least 10 feet on its turn, attack rolls against it have disadvantage until the start of its next turn unless the xiphus is incapacitated or restrained.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The goo can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Deadly to Fey
fields.desc: The goo has advantage on attack rolls against fey and any creature with the Fey Ancestry trait.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The goo can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Resilient Soul
fields.desc: The yakirian has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or confused, as well as against any effect that causes corruption or madness.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The yann-an-oed can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The yann-an-oed has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

fields.name: Devouring Swarm
fields.desc: If a creature has three or more yek attached to it from a bite attack at the end of its turn, the creature must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or its Constitution score is reduced by 1d4 as the demons feast upon the creature's flesh.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The yek has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The yek has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the yek's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The dragon sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The dragon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Void Traveler
fields.desc: The light dragon travels from star to star and does not require air, food, drink, or sleep. When flying between stars, the light dragon magically glides on solar winds, making the immense journey through the void in an impossibly short time.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the ziphius moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a dorsal fin attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 27 (5d10) slashing damage.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The ziphius deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Telepathic Foresight
fields.desc: As a bonus action at the start of its turn, the ziphius can choose one creature within 120 feet that it can see. The ziphius' eyes glow, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or the ziphius creates a temporary mental bond with the target until the start of the ziphius' next turn. While bonded, the ziphius reads the creature's surface thoughts, choosing to either gain advantage on attacks against that target or cause the target to have disadvantage on attacks against the ziphius.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The ziphius can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Fire and Light
fields.desc: The zoryas' weapon attacks are magical. When the zoryas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 radiant or fire damage (included in the attack). The zoryas chooses whether its attack does radiant or fire damage before making the attack roll.

fields.name: Open Celestial Gate
fields.desc: As an action, the zoryas opens a gateway to the celestial plane. The gate appears as a shimmering circle that sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet and is framed by twisting, golden strands. The gate lasts 1 hour; though, the zoryas can choose to close it at any time as a bonus action. Once the gate closes, the zoryas is reduced to 0 hp and remains unconscious for six days, awakening, fully restored, at sunrise on the seventh day. The zoryas can't pass through its own gate.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The zoryas regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the zoryas takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zoryas' next turn. The zoryas' body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

fields.name: Sun's Guidance (3/Day)
fields.desc: The zoryas has advantage on melee attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
